Chap. 35 - The Influence of Perception


     A Law in Intellectual and Spiritual Worlds.--It is a law both of the intellectual and the spiritual nature that by beholding we become changed. The mind gradually adapts itself to the subjects upon which it is allowed to dwell. It becomes assimilated to that which it is accustomed to love and reverence.--GC 555 (1888).
